title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis, a prospect for the Boston Bruins, gained attention after a strong performance at the 2025 IIHF World Championships.
Locmelis, a 2022 fourth-round pick, impressed with Latvia, scoring four goals and six points in seven games against NHL talent.
Providence Bruins coach Ryan Mougenel praises Locmelis for his rapid adaptation to pro hockey and potential impact at training camp.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye's timid performance against the Raiders in the season opener.
The Patriots lost 20-13 to the Raiders, with issues in special teams and defense allowing big plays.
Drake Maye threw one touchdown and an interception, struggling in the second half as the Raiders secured their lead.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, of Braintree, died weeks after being hit by an e-bike in Copley Square on August 6.
The incident occurred near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street in front of the Boston Public Library.
The e-bike operator, who stayed at the scene, has not been identified or charged, according to police.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: King tides in Boston, known scientifically as perigean spring tides, are expected throughout the fall.
The tides occur when the moon's orbit and phases align, causing the ocean tide to rise two to four feet higher.
High tide events hosted by Stone Living Lab will take place at Long Wharf starting September 11.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs supports Patriots QB Drake Maye amid criticism, describing him as tough and open to hard coaching.
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards with one touchdown and one interception in Patriots' 20-13 loss to Raiders.
Patriots' Stefon Diggs made six catches for 57 yards in his debut, aiming to build a strong rapport with Maye.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A state audit revealed DESE failed to investigate 22 supported child abuse reports over 41 months.
Communication breakdown between DESE and DCF started in February 2020, halting receipt of abuse report records.
Audit also found DESE delayed in addressing special education and LGBTQ student support issues.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Charlie Kirk, conservative activist and Trump ally, fatally shot at Utah Valley University event.
Massachusetts politicians, including Gov. Maura Healey, condemned political violence following Kirk's death.
Law enforcement questioned and released a suspect; FBI Director confirms no apparent multiple suspect involvement.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez remains out of practice with a hamstring injury since July 28, jeopardizing his play in Week 2.
Harold Landry and Morgan Moses missed Wednesday’s practice with foot injuries, adding concerns for the Patriots' lineup.
Patriots' secondary struggles without Gonzalez; his absence poses challenges against Dolphins' wideouts Hill and Waddle.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye acknowledged he rushed throws in the Patriots' loss to the Raiders, missing some open receivers.
Maye completed 30 of 46 passes for 287 yards and a touchdown, emphasizing the need to capitalize in the red zone.
The Patriots were 1-for-3 in red zone attempts against the Raiders, suggesting room for improvement in scoring efficiency.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown addressed the possibility of playing for the Atlanta Hawks, citing his Georgia roots and family connections.
Brown remains with the Celtics under a four-year contract and will take on a greater role with Tatum injured.
Despite trade rumors, Celtics' front office backs Brown, expecting his leadership for the retooled team in the upcoming season.
